intro: Memecylon lawsonii var. pedicellata, commonly known as the pedicellate memecylon, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers that appear in axillary inflorescences. Its fruits are small, woody capsules that split open to release seeds. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
